H0.text: Drinking water is an activity after which insulin levels in a healthy body increase.

H1.text: Taking a nap is an activity after which insulin levels in a healthy body increase, as insulin is a chemical released by the endocrine system to increase the absorption of glucose by the body's cells.

H2.text: Swimming is an activity after which insulin, a chemical released by the endocrine system to increase the absorption of glucose by the body's cells, increases in a healthy body.

H3.text: Eating is the activity after which insulin levels in a healthy body increase, because insulin is released by the endocrine system to increase the absorption of glucose by the body's cells.

A4.text: An insulin spike is a 'first response' to blood glucose increase, this response is individual and dose specific although it was always previously assumed to be food type specific only.

A5.text: Insulin release from the pancreas is not continuous, but oscillates with a period of 3â€“6 minutes, changing from generating a blood insulin concentration more than about 800 p mol/l to less than 100 pmol/L (in rats).
